item.description:
Why should we avoid using PALM OIL in our prepared foods or our cooking?

Event Description:
The Hutan Project Presents two FREE movies on Thursday evening, August 26th: Orang Rimba and Green at
Coolidge Corner Theater
290 Harvard Street
Brookline, MA 02446

August 26, 2010 07:00PM to 09:00PM
Hosted by Mike Kissinger of South Boston, MA

(MBTA Green Line C line is closest; #66 stops nearly in front of the theater; MBTA Green Line B Line is also close)

Visit http://events.ran.org.../ for more details and to register.

The Indonesian rain forest is a beautiful place. As the third largest rain forest in the world, it is home to more than 12 percent of animal and plant species, including the remarkable "people of the forest" - the orangutans. See these incredibly human creatures in action and meet the people trying to save them from extinction in the wild.

The Hutan Project, a social venture of Tech Networks of Boston, will be screening two films at the Coolidge Corner Theater at 7 PM on August 26th: Orang Rimba and Green.

"Orang Rimba" tells the story of Indigenous peoples impacted by deforestation.

"Green" tells the emotional story of a female orangutan in Indonesia and how the everyday products we buy here at home are affecting beautiful creatures like her.

Come spend an evening getting to know these beautiful creatures and meeting others who share a passion for healing our planet. After the movie you will have a chance to win fair trade Indonesian products that protect the rain forest, and learn about innovative organizations that are buying land, rescuing orangutans, and even creating new rain forests from scarred and burned land.

This screening is being put on by the Hutan Project, a social venture of
Tech Networks of Boston.
Visit them online at http://www.techboston...

So, attend the free film screening. It's on Thursday, August 26th, at the Coolidge Corner Theatre.

In addition to screening two films about the Indonesian rain forest, TechNetworks will be showcasing rain forest aid organizations they support, then giving away products that (purportedly) "help the rain forest".

Find out about their social venture: The Hutan Project.
Hutan means forest in Indonesian. We're saving trees in Indonesia and here in Boston, too!

Click here to register for the event.
Thanks for your support!

Max Attendees: 45 (Currently 11 Registered)

Location:
290 Harvard Street
Directions:
See the page below for directions by car or public transit: http://www.coolidge.o...
item.how_to_find_us: Just get good seats! Enjoy the two movies, but plan to show up at least 15-20 minutes early to get those seats!

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group
